dialog.text: Hello. The seeker  felt scared and worried about losing his job. The supporter could tell the seeker the there are other jobs that are more important to him.
Hi, how are you?
Thanks for asking. To be honest, I am very depressed recently. The seeker  feels sad and depressed. The supporter should also try to get support.
Oh, I'm so sorry to hear that. What happened?

It is about helping to raise my grandson and his dad is not helping at all. His dad doesn't care about my feelings and I really start to feel it difficult taking care of kids. I'm losing my patience. The seeker  tries to tell the supporter that he will not hurt him in any way. This tactic is not to hurt the seeker because he doesn't care about the seeker. The seeker should think about the seeker's feelings, and how his friends and family would like to help him in the future.
I can understand how you feel. It's hard when one parent doesn't support the other. Have you tried to talk to your grandson about the situation?
beam_texts: I can understand how you feel. It's hard when one parent doesn't support the other. Have you tried to talk to your grandson about the situation?

dialog.text: I have tried to talk to him, but he doesn't seem to care at all. His dad is just so busy, he barely has time to talk to him. The seeker  feels very depressed. The supporter could talk about how they might try to raise the child or make a life for the child or maybe even make the child go out with them.
I can understand why your son might feel that way. I know that I would feel upset if my grandson didn't support me.
beam_texts: I can understand why your son might feel that way. I know that I would feel upset if my grandson didn't support me.

dialog.text: I would too! But he has a dad who is always available. I'm not sure what I can do to make him care more. The seeker  feels very sad about losing his job. The supporter could give advice on how to support his grandson.
Have you thought about seeing a therapist to talk about this? Does your son have any siblings that you are close to?
beam_texts: Have you thought about seeing a therapist to talk about this? Does your son have any siblings that you are close to?

dialog.text: I have thought about a therapist, but I'm not sure how they would help. My son is an only child. The seeker  feels worried about losing his job. The supporter could share some similar experience and suggest the seeker to stay positive.

I think a therapist would be a great way to help you both. It could be a bonding experience for you and your son. Often times, people who have issues with anxiety and depression need help dealing with those issues.
beam_texts: I think a therapist would be a great way to help you both. It could be a bonding experience for you and your son. Often times, people who have issues with anxiety and depression need help dealing with those issues.

dialog.text: I think I'll give it a try. Maybe it can help me feel more cared for. The seeker  feels anxious about getting out of his job and living a happy life. The supporter could ask for more information about how their son and daughter deal with their problems.
I think that would be great,.
beam_texts: I think that would be great,.

dialog.text: I agree, thank you for talking with me. The seeker  feels lost and lonely. The supporter could be a therapist or a caregiver.
You are very welcome!
Have a good day! The seeker  looks at the seeker, but the supporter does not. The seeker continues to look at the seeker and does not reply.
you too.

Thank you. The seeker  feels lonely. The supporter could tell the seeker that there are many people around him who need help. The seeker could tell the seeker that there are people around her who need help. The supporter could tell the seeker that there are people around her who need help. The supporter could tell the seeker that there are people around her who need help. The supporter could tell the seeker that there are people around her
you're welcome.
Have a nice day! The seeker  feels feeling uncomfortable.
you too.

Thank you. The seeker  feels comfortable and relaxed about his problems. The seeker can tell the seeker that it is difficult to work on his skills. The supporter could also tell the seeker that he needs a job to do this.
you're welcome.

you too.

Thank you. The seeker  feels nervous, depressed and scared. The supporter could tell the seeker that they want to make their child feel more accepted. The supporter could also tell them the seeker is stressed, but not worried. The supporter could also tell the seeker they need more support.
you're welcome.
Thank you. The seeker  felt depressed about losing his job. The supporter could tell the seeker the reasons for that depression.
you're welcome.
Thank you. The seeker  is worried about losing his job. The supporter could share some similar experience and suggest the seeker to stay positive.
you're welcome.
Thank you. The seeker  feels happy to be out with his family. The supporter could tell the seeker about some interesting things he has been doing that he would like to do before he leaves.
you're welcome.

you're welcome.
Thank you. The seeker  feels anxious about being with a person in his company. The supporter could tell the seeker that he is not a good fit with that person.
you're welcome.
